New Records: Sadeera Samarawickrama scored 91 runs for Sri Lanka, the highest score in the match.
Aryan Dutt became the highest impact player with 114.03 points in the match.
Key Match Events: Key wickets fell at crucial moments, including Kusal Perera (18) and Kusal Mendis (52) for Sri Lanka, and Sybrand Engelbrecht (221) and Logan van Beek (252) for Netherlands.
Sri Lanka won by 5 wickets with 10 balls remaining after Netherlands were all out for 262.
Sri Lanka's Sadeera Samarawickrama and Charith Asalanka formed a significant partnership of 104 runs for the third wicket.
Pre-Game Insights: Netherlands elected to bat first after winning the toss.
Sri Lanka's bowlers were expected to dominate due to their strong pace attack.
Post-Match Reflections: Sadeera Samarawickrama was named Player of the Match for his outstanding performance.
Netherlands coach expressed frustration at their batting performance but praised the team's spirit.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Bharat Ratna Shri Atal Bihari Vajpayee Ekana Cricket Stadium in Lucknow.
Sri Lanka's victory extended their dominance in the ICC World Cup, having previously won the tournament in 2013.
Others: The match was the 19th of the 2023-24 ICC Cricket World Cup, with Sri Lanka securing a 2-point win.
